result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Nathine Riddle 4C Bed 2 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *4/26/2016 Honorable Jeffrey A. Kremers-Order signed.  Credit amended to 172 days.

No contact with firearms.
The defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms.  
The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The Court found the defendant indigent and waived all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 1.  *4/26/2016 credit amended to 172 days.
The Court found the defendant indigent and waived all costs and surcharges.

Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (18 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 3, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Mark Nathine Riddle in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Mark Nathine Riddle in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
This case was called earlier but adjourned because a PSI was not ordered.  After speaking with his client, defense counsel is in court and informs the court that his client wants to go forward with sentencing today.
.
Sentencing proceeded...
.
As to count 1:
Statements as to sentencing by both counsel.  The victim has been notified but is not present.
  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 48 months in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 157 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 18 months and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 30 months with the following conditions:
   
     *  The court found the defendant indigent and waived all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges.
     *  No contact with firearms.
     *  The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence. 

As to count 4:
Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent with count 1, 157 days credit.  The court found the defendant indigent and waived all costs and surcharges.
  
The defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms.  
The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Wisconsin Abuse Program.
.
Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, credit form, ineligible voting rights form.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant Mark Nathine Riddle not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The court was informed that the defense had asked for a PSI in this case for sentencing.  It was never ordered.
Case adjourned for another sentencing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant Mark Nathine Riddle not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel is waiving the defendant's appearance for now.
State is ready to proceed with the trial without their witnesses.
.
Case passed..
.
Back on the record, same appearances, defendant now in court.
.
As to counts 1 and 4:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to counts 2 and 3:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.  Defendant remanded for sentencing.



  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant Mark Nathine Riddle not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Telephone call to Br. 23 to obtain a status date.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark Nathine Riddle in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Mark Nathine Riddle in custody.  Micha Schwab, student intern under the supervision of Sarra Kiaie for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant pleads not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Diana T.; SLT dob 10/12/02; JLT dob 2/17/07 and STT dob 7/28/05

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2, 3 & 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
